item.title: Central team inspects Raichur Thermal Power Station in Karnataka for nuclear energy potential
item.description:
<![CDATA[1
2
Bengaluru: A central power ministry team is in Raichur Thermal Power Station (RTPS) to assess the feasibility of setting up a nuclear power plant.The drought-prone district in the heart of Kalyana Karnataka already hosts two major thermal power stations that together generate about 3,320 MW of electricity, supplying nearly half of Karnataka's power needs.Sources in Raichur said a three-member technical team is conducting inspections to evaluate the possibility of establishing a nucle...]]>
